content.question: Which of the following is a correct expression for the magnetic force per unit length <math alttext="the fraction F over L" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mi>F</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>L</mi></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math> exerted on the conductor and indicates the correct direction?

choices.label: <math alttext="I B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>I</mi><mi>B</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>; toward the top of the page
<math alttext="I B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>I</mi><mi>B</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>; toward the bottom of the page
<math alttext="I B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>I</mi><mi>B</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>; toward the right
<math alttext="I B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>I</mi><mi>B</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>; toward the left
<math alttext="0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>; the direction is undefined

content.answer: <math alttext="I B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>I</mi><mi>B</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>; toward the top of the page

topic.text: 12.3: Magnetic Fields of Current-Carrying Wires and the Biot-Savart Law

skill.text: 3.B: Apply an appropriate law, definition, theoretical relationship, or model to make a claim.
